text:
Big banana nose, good wheat, a little clove. Hazy orange pour nice white head. Flavors of big banana, clove, wheat. Bubble gum is here a well. Lingering sweet wheat and banana. Nice carbonation. Solid and well done.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16oz can. Hazy orange color with a white head. Citrus orange wheat aroma. Wheat orange citrus flavor. Medium body. Easy drinking.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at La Cumbre Brewing, Albuquerque. Colour is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, banana, wheat and malts. Pretty good hefe.
Can: Poured a golden with white head. Nice juicy and wheat nose. Taste is banana, clove and wheat.

Refrigerated 16 oz. aluminum can from GTAEgeek poured into a weizen glass. Cloudy orange with small white head. Aroma is nice clove, medium body, medium carbonation, and good small-bubble lacing. Taste is clove, banana, and bubble-gum. Nice hefe.
On tap at Falling Rock, golden yellow with soft foam, aroma is creamy wheat, smooth banana and citrus , wheat Flavors, very nice

16 oz. can. Canned 5/30/16. BBD 8/28/16. Having followed instructions to give a partial can a swirl, to get the yeast, it pours a medium, poorly retained ivory head, with slight lacing, over an effervescent, hazy gold (SRM 5) body......nose is banana/bubblegum, heavy clove,  light apple, hints of lemon, wheat, no hops......taste is slightly sweet, with heavy banana/bubblegum, balancing clove, light wheat, dry finish, no hop bitterness.......mouth feel, light body, no alcohol, moderate fizzy carbonation. This is a nice rendition of this relatively light, highly refreshing, aromatic and flavorful style. BJCP 8/3/15/5/8

Aroma - yeasty that has a banana quality and spiced yeast.
Appearance - the body is a hazy yellow, with good nucleation. The head is 1 1/2" and fizzles out into a thin ring.
Taste - has a some spiced wheat, banana like yeast, and some lemon.
Palate - medium body, creamy and soft texture, soft carbonation, and soft yeasty finish.

Type: 16-oz. can
Glass: Clear 8-oz. tumbler glass
From: Trader Joes in (Uptown) Albuquerque, N.M.
Price: $2.38
Purchased: May 6, 2016
Consumed: May 7, 2016
Misc.: No BOD 

Had a taster of this back in 2014 on a trip to Albuquerque at the La Cumbre Brewery and I remember really liking it. Passed on reviewing it on May 5 when I went to La Cumbre again, but picked up a can at an ABQ Trader Joes the final day. Hoping this one still holds up. 

Poured a golden, straw, hazy color with 1-to-2 fingers of gray, fizzy head, which dissipated rather quickly. A good deal of carbonated bubbles coming up from the bottom of the glass. Poor wet lacing. Poor retention. (Sight - 3.25)

Smelled peppery spices, coriander, honey, banana, banana chips, cloves, vanilla and leathery notes. (Smell - 4.00)

Taste mostly followed the nose, getting banana, cloves, peppery spices, honey, coriander peel, hints of vanilla, some Circus Peanuts candy and green grapes. Very sweet. (Taste - 4.00) 

Light body. Oily-to-thin texture. Lively carbonation. Long, spicy finish. (Feel - 4.00)

This was just as good as I remember. A bit sweeter than I remember, but tasty nonetheless. (Overall - 4.00)

3.96 89 B+

Can thanks to Will. Pours a hazy orange yellow with small white head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is clove, wheat, banana, citrus. Medium mouth, similar flavors to nose, light dry finish, very good.

Canned. Cloudy dark orange with a small white head. The aroma is overtly spicy with cloves, allspice, and hay. The flavor is a big blast of banana backed by cloves and followed up by a hint of mild hallertau hops. The palate is full and lush, the finish is long with linger spiced banana. Overall: This is one of the best US Hefes I have had in a long time. It is true to the style and is probably only exceeded by New Glarus stuff. Well done Jeff.

Hazy deep golden with a tight and thick white head. Big dry wheaty aroma with a kiss of ripe banana and belgianesque dustiness. Full wheaty and semisweet banana flavor with loads of complexity and a little earthiness. Some mild clove rounds out a very German finish. Pretty damn lovely.

Pint can. Wheat malt aroma with bready yeast, hop, clove, lemony citrus and light banana notes. Pours cloudy golden colored with a thin white head with mediocre retention and minimal lacing. Starts very malty with wheat and bread yeastiness as well as a bit of clove. Finishes smooth and refreshing with light banana sweetness, light spicy hop bitterness and lemon citrus and acidity that lingers on the palate. Solid hefe, but a little light on the banana.

Can. Murky honeylike hue with a fizzy head that evaporates quickly. Aromas heavy on the phenolics: smoky clove, black pepper, a little adhesive. Flavor, too, could use more fruit presence, as clove covers soft banana, peardrop and dry, tannic wheat. Flashes with a dollop of malt sweetness before a dryn underwhelming finish. Not terrible for an American-made hef, but theres nothing here that brings it to the level of the classics of the style.

Can. Pours a cloudy gold with a thin white head. Aroma of banana, clove, bready malt, spices, yeast. Flavor of yeast and bready malt upfront with sweet bubblegum, banana, light fruits, and spices in the finish. Very classic hefe, well done, super refreshing.
7/4/8/4/14 (3.7/5)

Sample from a can. Pours a pale, clear, straw color. The nose is bread yeast, lemon zest, banana peel, and wheat. Sweet flavor, with just a hint of some esters. Light body, smooth, and a little flat. Overall, this is a pretty good wheat beer, but lacks some of the character of a good hefeweizen. Still, a solid beer.

16 oz single, drank via can, purchased at the Craft Beer Cellar - Fort Collins. Aroma and flavor of yeast, bread, herbs (clove), light spicy hops and hints of banana and fruity esters. Crisp and balanced with a smooth finish. Enjoyable.

Can from Whole Foods -Indian Plaza. Solid weizen, only knock is a head which fades way too quickly. Aroma ànd taste on target, body almost heavy enough to match up with the Germans. One of the best American hefes Ive tried.
Aroma was sweet and slightly floral. Color was a nice clear, but with no head. Taste was sweet and full. Finish was a bit lacking.
Cloudy yellowish pour, white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is banana and some mild spice, Citrus. Taste follows suit, chewy mouthfeel. Good stuff.
6oz on tap @ Backstreet Grill. Pours cloudy golden with a medium head. Aroma is malts, wheat and banana. Flavor is quite similar. Decent.

Im not a wheat bear fan, so take this review with grain of salt. I was in ABQ for a couple of days, and had to try some Le Cumbre. I tried all I could find except a stout, which I wish Id picked up. Aroma is yeast, citrus. Mine has a good bit of carbonation and a nice head. Taste is yeast sourness (quite subdued) and clove. Seems a bit lacking in body. Decent and drinkable.
From the can. Citrus, light spice, wheat and faint yeast. Very smooth, very balanced. Solid aroma and mouthfeel. Another winner.

Can pours an opaque orangish yellow color with a huge billowing white head that lingers leaving quite a bit of lace on glass. Smells of bananas, yeast, fresh baked white bread and fruity bubblegum. Tastes of bananas, yeast, bread, a hint of clove and spicey wheat. Light to medium body, perfect carbonation, silky mouthfeel and a nice refreshing tart finish. Wow this beer is fantastic! So refreshing and easy to put down on a hot spring day! I love this style and I think it is perfect, and its even better on tap. Dont know why all the low marks???? Oh well got to be some haters out there. Maybe you should go to the brewery and try it fresh. You will change your mind!

Can, part of a 4-pack, provided by Kevin. Pours lightly hazy orange with a large, frothy white head, long retention with light lacing. Aroma is banana, light clove and citrus fruits, and heavy earthy and spicy wheat malt. Flavor is lightly sweet earthy and spicy wheat malt, light banana and cloves with a slight citrus acidity and a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.

4 pack of pint cans packaged on 2-23-15 from Dicks. Im drinking the last one today. This one has the same problem the other three cans had: very low carbonation. Sadly a hefeweizen is a style that really needs active carbonation to be enjoyable. The pour is pretty lifeless with no head formation and minimal bubbles in the cloudy orange body. Aroma is solid with pleasant suggestions of orange, banana, wheat bread and tasteful, subdued clove notes. The flavor is clean too with pleasant esters and a solid wheaty body. Fresh citrus is also here. But the low carbonation is very distracting. This is tantamount to drinking a very low carbed pilsner or geuze.

16oz can poured into a tall glass. Hazy pale straw, short lived two finger head. Big, artificial banana candy aroma, like a bag of banana laffy taffy. Clove, if there was any, was drowned out by the banana. Medium body, and creamy mouthfeel. Flavor was overly sweet, with tons of ripe, mashed banana, but not much else.
16 ounce aluminum CaN .. Shared by Scott E .. . Cloudy gold tangerine .. Citrus, wheat, and sweet gum .. No foam .. Nice tastin, lifeless looking .. . . You smell like nothing. Thank you

16 oz can poured a clear gold with a lingering ring of white foam. Aromas of wheat, yeast, citrus and light clove. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a smooth dry finish. Flavors of wheat, yeastclove and a hint of citrus with a smooth dry lingering clove finish.

Big banana nose, good wheat, a little clove. Hazy orange pour nice white head. Flavors of big banana, clove, wheat. Bubble gum is here a well. Lingering sweet wheat and banana. Nice carbonation. Solid and well done.
draft at brewery, the banana is strong with this one. Tons of banana and wheat, its blinding. cant taste anything else......

Des céréales croustillantes comme on trouve dans une Helles ou une Pilsner mais avec des soubresauts modérés de clou de girofle et de banane. Très frais et tranchant avec une buvabilité effrayante, pas la soupe repas chargée damidon qui caractérise souvent le style.

Can brought back by David and shared tonight at the Christmas Party. 
Rich bready malt with light citrus and lots of banana and clove to counter. Smooth rich flavor, light yeasty flavors. Nice Hefe!

Sampled at GABF 2014. Pours a beautiful, hazy orange creme with white lacing. Aroma is super wheaty with light banana character. Mouthfeel is medium to full-bodied with notes of spice, rich wheat, yeast, light grass and banana. Nice wheat.
Can. The look is cloudy, thin white head, and golden peach colored. The smell is lemon, wheat, yeast, sweet, and ok. The taste is wheat, banana, fruit, sweet, lemon, ok.
16 oz can. Cloudy gold with an average white head. Aroma is of citrus, banana, and clove. Taste is of clove, banana, light cinnamon, and yeast.
On tap at pub. Pours out a peach color topped with a white head. Nose is banana clove and a nice fruit kick. Taste is as the nose with a little spice.

Fresh can. One of the best for this style I have had. Comes close to Live Oak Hef. Lots of banana yeasty bubblegum goodness. Great summer beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can thanks to Jake. Pours gold white head. Nose/taste of banana, lemon, light wheat and coriander. Lighter bodied.

Sampled from the tap at the brewery. Pours a cloudy yellow gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a nice combination of sweet wheat, light clove and a hint of banana. Flavor has much more clove with banana and sweet wheat backing.
Pours a bright but cloudy golden color with white head. Raw wheat, coriander, clove and some yeast on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with some yeast notes.
Totally unfiltered! Lots of spice flavor, without excess sweetness. Limited head as expected. Impossible to get more flavor in a 5.1% brew!

Lightly hazy, light tan colour. Very sweet nose, banana but also some bubblegum, higher alcohols. Body is a bit thin and also a bit sticky...an odd combination. Phenols are plastic first then bubblegum. Cloying finish. Sorry, Jeff, this just didnt work at all for me.

473ml can from Elise. Hazy yellow orange body. Not much of a head. Pleasant honey banana-clove aroma. Medium bodied, well balanced. Smooth golden malt tones, big yeast notes. Some lemony clove tart bitterness up front, but fades into a sweet malty finish. A pretty solid stateside Hefe.

Tall boy can via trade. Drank out the can right after cleaning up the garage on a hot Florida day. Nose is full of banana with a citrus hint that is barely there. Taste is initially very grainy, bready with some vanilla phenols. Moderate banana and bubble gum as well. Medium carbonation. Very quenching and refreshing on a Summer day

Out of the can and on tap at the brewery tap room. Both incredibly good. Best Hefe I have personally ever have enjoyed. Poors clearer out of the can. A darker cloudy appearance from the tap. Both very smooth and refreshing as would would expect from a quality Hefe!! Enjoy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

473 mL can opened and shared with WillRunForBeer. Many thanks! To pint, it pours a hazy safety orange; no head, only bubbles on the top surface emerged. Aromas of cloves, allspice, marshmallow root, bitter orange, germinated wheat, and vanillin. Tastes the same with the addition mashed banana, red licorice candies, candle wax, and German yeast. Spicily alluring. Fun beer.

16oz can from trade. Pours orange gold with a offwhite head that dissipates quickly. Strong aroma of unripe banana, clove. Flavor follows nose, a bit mineral and a touch of orange in the finish. A solid hefe.

American hefe. Why can't we do it like ze Germans? Bubblegum on the nose, grassy gold and cloudy, light mouthfeel and a pleasant flavor, but there's just missing something. Franziskaner is king for me. It manages to be light yet full. This one just kind if lists it's way to a unmemorable finish. Slice a lemon and put me on a porch on a hot summer's day with a growler of this and you'll get no complaints from this guy, but you won't find me ordering this at a bar...ever. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at the brewery. Comes a cloudy pale gold with a nice white head. Aroma of fruit, yeast, and spice. Taste is citrus, banana, yeast, and spices. Nice.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2014 In can, nice, creamy structure and marshmellowy mouthfeel. The yeast shows phenolic flavors of banana and cloves with aa dry and tart edge, some spiciness, bubblegum or notes of apples. Little hop bitterness, and a moderate level of alcohol. Overall, a nice expression of the style.

Draft at taproom. Pours yellow and cloudy with a white head that leaves some lacing. Big banana and bubble gum on the nose. Lots of banana on the tongue with a hint of the bubble gum. Finishes a little dry. Fantastic example of the style.
At the brew pub on draft a cloudy golden with a slight head aroma of cloves and orange tastes of banana rather sweet on the Palate it goes down very easy
On draft at the brewpub in Albuquerque. Pours a cloudy pale gold with a white head. Orange nose. Banana and orange flavors. Smooth mellow mouthfeel and finish.

Tap at the brewery. Murky golden pour with good lacing. Big banana esters in the nose with pear, yellow apple. Taste is a tad too buttery with some soap, yellow apple. Palate is nice. Butter doesnt distract after awhile.
Tap at La Cumbre. Pours standard hazy yellow with fluffy topper. Aroma is banana.  Taste is yeasty and spicy with some fruity notes.  Full mouthfeel. Tasty example of the style.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2014 Tap @ La Cumbre. Pours a milky yellow orange appearance with a white head. Spicy banana, clove, chewy yeasty, quite spicy aroma. Refreshing, somewhat citrusy, zesty carbonated, spicy yeasty, tangy, fruity flavor. Pretty tasty. (3.8)
GABF 2014. Pretty intense clove. A little soapy. Pretty good. (3.8)

10oz draft from La Cumbre; November 2012
The beer arrives with a hazy, orange-tinged straw color that is topped by a ¼-finger thick, pale head. The nose has lots of clove character to it, some tart wheat notes, as well as an expressive, floral character to it. Other notes of pepper and even some plum fruitiness come out as I dig into the aroma a bit.

The beer has a nice crispness to it up front and this is accentuated by a light hop bite. A banana note towards the finish melds into a hay like grain note in the long finish. This has a nice carbonic bite to it, which plays nicely with the light body, but there is enough heft here that it has some palate presence while remaining quite quaffable. A soft herbal flavor is here in the flavor, though it is not overly defined. The nose is really nice, though the flavor seems a bit washed out (though maybe the pulled pork sandwich I had affected this), but still this is quite nice in the end, and Ill have to have this again.

On tap at the brewery many times, currently at Burts. Masterful balance of flavor and easy drankin. Moderate banana. Lots of yeast character, but it isnt overpowering at all. One of the best hefes Ive had.

Bottle 22fl.oz.Hazy matt medium yellow colour with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is light malty, wheat, moderate to light light heavy yeasty, banana, yeast. Flavour is moderate to light light heavy sweet and light bitter with a long duration, fruity, yeast, clove. Body is medium, texture is creamy, carbonation is soft. [20120529]

Bottled. An unclear golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of wheat and exotic fruits. The is sweet iwth notes of malt, pineapple, banana, and wheat, leading to a dry wheaty finish. Thanks pinball for sharing.
22 fl oz bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is dry estery and light fruity. Smooth fruity, banana and estery. Dry and mellow yeasty. Dry estery and light yeasty finish.
Bottled. Golden coloured. Unclear. Dense off white head. Aroma of citrus, spice, fruits, flavour of spice, fruits, yeast. banana. Medium bodied. Ends on a sweet and yeasty note. Qutie nice.
Bottle, courtesy of Pinball. Unclear yellow with a small white head. Wheaty, light citrusy aroma, spicey, yeasty. Banana, clove. Taste is wheaty sweetness, flowery hops, dry medium phenolic finish.

cloudy yellow, smooth white head.
wheaty aroma,  slightly peachy fruity,mild. nice.
flavor is wheaty, peachy, yellow fruity, faint bitterness, nice wheat.

Bottle 65 cl. Courtesy of Pinball. Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a white head. Distinct banana and yeast aroma and quite some clove for good measure. Medium body, lively carbonation, heavy on the banana notes, very yeasty with a phenollic touch. Ends dry. Unlike most US Hefes this is very true to an original German-style Hefe. Good but in no way outstanding for the style. 290512

Growler. Pours a nice hazy golden yellow with a white head. Aroma is of banana, clove, sugar, wheat and spice. The flavor is again of over ripe banana, spice like clove and a little pepper, wheat and a slight sugary note. The body is light with a dry mouth feel. Overall a pretty tasty Hefe that is quite authentic for being an American Interpretation.

Tap at brewpub Feb 2012-pours lovely cloudy dark yellow with a gith soapy white head and good lacing.  nose of equal pats ripe banana, a bit of sulfer character and bubblegum (sugar-free!).  flavors are huge banana, rich with lots of ripe sourness.  This is amazing!  Lite grains on the finish with lingering banana undertones.  Wow, my notes keep saying "wow" repeatedly. Clean ferment with tons of character.  one lovely representation of this style and im going out on a limb to say its just as good as the best New Glarus Hefes they have ever made.  Hats off again to Erway!

On tap at ONiells.  Deep opaque yellow color with a small white head.  Aroma is lemon and doughy.  Strong yeast profile and slight lemon flavor.  This is a fantastic hefeweizen, good wheat notes and very memorable.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2012 5.4% ABV. 22oz glass (standard pour) @ brewpub. Murky as fuck, yellowish, smallish off white head. Aroma is banana & spicy clove. Taste is banana, clove, black pepper and wheat. There seems to be a heft to the beer, initally, but the finish is balanced. This is pretty much a spot on example of the style. This would be a mid 40s if judged via BJCP.
